These ancient artists chisel, smooth, and lay down layer after layer—until the land stretches out flat. Over thousands of years, rugged terrain becomes the cradle of civilizations.</lead_in> <infographic_captions> <item key="Floodplain Zone">When rivers flood, they leave behind a gift: rich, dark soil that makes plains bloom.</item> <item key="Glacial Plain">As glaciers melt and retreat, they scrape valleys smooth and scatter fertile ground in their wake.</item> <item key="Erosional Plain">Even mountains, given time, bow to the power of wind and rain. What’s left is a land quieted into plains.</item> </infographic_captions> </textContent> <didYouKnow> <fact order="1">The Danube River’s floodplains recharge European farmland with fresh nutrients every single year.</fact> <fact order="2">Glacial retreat carved out Europe’s Lowlands, now home to millions.</fact> <fact order="3">Some plains, like India’s Deccan Plateau, were once highlands—eroded over eons into flatlands.</fact> </didYouKnow> <infographicLabels> <river_layer>Sediment Build-Up</river_layer> <glacier_layer>Retreating Glacier, Leaving Rich Soil</glacier_layer> <erosion_layer>Erosion Over Time: Mountains Become Meadows</erosion_layer> </infographicLabels> </textOutline> <assets> <asset role="infographic_floodplain_primary" sheet="How () Forms" cell="A3" label="Floodplain / river deposition (primary)" url="https://cdn.midjourney.com/d3ca3e14-68e0-4707-b03e-b30ab9fa48b1/0_3.png"> <notes> <prompt_or_description>A photorealistic cross-sectional view of a meandering river overflowing its banks, depositing rich sediments onto a fertile floodplain. <primaryObjective>Show the Eurasian Steppe as a continent-spanning ecological corridor: grassland scale, seasonal movement, and the animals that depend on open country.</primaryObjective> <visualConcept> <item order="1">Wide Eurasia map with the steppe belt highlighted; add arrows for migrations and seasonal movement.</item> <item order="2">Three circular wildlife photos (Saiga arrow directions.</item> </visualConcept> <textContent> <map_caption>The Eurasian Steppe is more than grass—it’s a living highway. Saiga antelope migrate hundreds of miles. Eagles soar across continents. And ancient winds carry life from horizon to horizon.</map_caption> <wildlife_captions> <item key="Saiga Antelope">With noses built to warm frigid air, saiga antelope are steppe survivors—and nomads by nature.</item> <item key="Steppe Eagle">Their wings span continents. Steppe eagles nest in Kazakhstan and winter in Africa.</item> <item key="Wild Horses (e.g., Przewalski’s horses)">The last truly wild horses still roam here, tracing the paths of their ancestors.</item> </wildlife_captions> </textContent> <didYouKnow> <fact order="1">The Eurasian Steppe stretches from Hungary to Mongolia—a distance greater than the width of the Atlantic Ocean.</fact> <fact order="2">Some steppe birds migrate from Central Asia all the way to southern Africa each year.</fact> <fact order="3">The saiga’s nose acts like a built-in air filter and heater—a
